properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, interactive content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Transparent, containing either flow content (excluding interactive content) or phrasing content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content, or any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Flow content, but with no nested <address> element, no heading content (<hgroup>, <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5>, <h6>), no sectioning content (<article>, <aside>, <section>, <nav>), and no <header> or <footer> element.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Prior to Gecko 2.0 (Firefox 4), Gecko implemented this element using the HTMLSpanElement interface

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content. The <area> element must have an ancestor <map>, but it need not be a direct parent.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that an <article> element must not be a descendant of an <address> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that an <aside> element must not be a descendant of an <address> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content. If it has a controls attribute: interactive content and palpable content.
properties.Permitted content:
If the element has a src attribute: zero or more <track> element, followed by transparent content that contains no media elements, that is no <audio> or <video>
    Else: zero or more <source> element, followed by zero or more <track> element, followed by transparent content that contains no media elements, that is no <audio> or <video>.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: There must be no closing tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any <head> that doesn't contain any other <base> element

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning root, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Sectioning root.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag may be omitted if the first thing inside it is not a space character, comment, <script> element or <style> element. The end tag may be omitted if the body element has contents or has a start tag, and is not immediately followed by a comment.
properties.Permitted parent elements: It must be the second element of an <html> element.
properties.DOM interface:
HTMLBodyElement
    
     The <body> element exposes the HTMLBodyElement interface.
     You can access the body element through the document.body attribute.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag, and must not have an end tag. In XHTML documents, write this element as .
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, Interactive content, listed, labelable, and submittable form-associated element, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Transparent but with no interactive content descendants except for <a> elements, <button> elements, <input> elements whose type attribute is checkbox, radio, or button.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing_content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <table> element, as its first descendant.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag is mandatory, but, as it is a void element, the use of an end tag is forbidden.
properties.Permitted parent elements: <colgroup> only, though it can be implicitly defined as its start tag is not mandatory. The <colgroup> must not have a span attribute.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content:
If the span attribute is present: none, it is an empty element.
    If the attribute is not present: zero or more <col> element
properties.Tag omission:
The start tag may be omitted, if it has a <col> element as its first child and if it is not preceded by a <colgroup> whose end tag has been omitted.
    The end tag may be omitted, if it is not followed by a space or a comment.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <table> element. The <colgroup> must appear after any optional <caption> element but before any <thead>, <th>, <tbody>, <tfoot> and <tr> element.

properties.Content categories: Transparent content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Permitted content: Either phrasing content or zero or more <option> elements.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag is required. The end tag may be omitted if the <dd> element is immediately followed by another <dd> element, or if there is no more content in the parent element.
properties.Permitted parent elements: <dl> or (in WHATWG HTML) a <div> that is inside a <dl>.

properties.Content categories: Phrasing content or flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning root, interactive content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: One <summary> element followed by flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Phrasing content, but no <dfn> element must be a descendant.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content:
Flow content.
    Or (in WHATWG HTML): If the parent is a <dl> element: one or more <dt> elements followed by one or more <dd> elements, optionally intermixed with <script> and <template> elements.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements:
Any element that accepts flow content.
    Or (in WHATWG HTML): <dl> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, and if the <dl> element's children include one name-value group, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content:
Zero or more groups each consisting of one or more <dt> elements followed by one or more <dd> elements, optionally intermixed with <script> and <template> elements.
    Or (in WHATWG HTML): One or more <div> elements, optionally intermixed with <script> and <template> elements.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: Flow content, but with no <header>, <footer>, sectioning content or heading content descendants.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag. The end tag may be omitted if this element is immediately followed by another <dd> element, or if there is no more content in the parent element.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Before a <dt> or a <dd> element, inside a <dl> or (in WHATWG HTML) a <div> that is inside a <dl>.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content, interactive content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag, and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning root, listed, form-associated element, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: An optional <legend> element, followed by flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <figure> element; the <figcaption> element must be its first or last child.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning root, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: A <figcaption> element, followed by flow content; or flow content followed by a <figcaption> element; or flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts Flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Flow content, but with no <footer> or <header> descendants.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that a <footer> element must not be a descendant of an <address>, <header> or another <footer> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content
properties.Permitted content: Flow content, but not containing <form> elements
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content; don't use as a child of <hgroup> element, it is now deprecated

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content:
If the element is an <iframe> srcdoc, or if title information is available from a higher level protocol, zero or more elements of metadata content.
    Otherwise, one or more elements of metadata content where exactly one is a <title> element.
properties.Tag omission:
The start tag may be omitted if the first thing inside the head element is an element.
    The end tag may be omitted if the first thing following the head element is not a space character or a comment.
properties.Permitted parent elements: An <html> element, as its first child.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Flow content, but with no <header> or <footer> descendant.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that a <header> element must not be a descendant of an <address>, <footer> or another <header> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, heading content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: It must have start tag, but must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: One <head> element, followed by one <body> element.
properties.Tag omission:
The start tag may be omitted if the first thing inside the <html> element is not a comment.
    The end tag may be omitted if the <html> element is not immediately followed by a comment, and it contains a <body> element either that is not empty or whose start tag is present.
properties.Permitted parent elements: As the root element of a document, or wherever a subdocument fragment is allowed in a compound document.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content, interactive content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content, palpable content. If the element has a usemap attribute, it also is a part of the interactive content category.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, listed, submittable, resettable, form-associated element, phrasing content. If the type is not hidden, then labellable element, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Phrasing content or flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the interface HTMLSpanElement for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, interactive content, listed, labelable, submittable, resettable  form-associated element, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, interactive content, form-associated element, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Phrasing content, but no descendant label elements. No labelable elements other than the labeled control are allowed.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <fieldset> whose first child is this <legend> element

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The end tag can be omitted if the list item is immediately followed by another <li> element, or if there is no more content in its parent element.
properties.Permitted parent elements: An <ul>, <ol>, or <menu> element. Though not a conforming usage, the obsolete <dir> can also be a parent.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content. If itemprop is present: flow content and phrasing content
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: As it is a void element, the start tag must be present and the end tag must not be present
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts metadata elements. If itemprop is present: any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None; both the starting and ending tags are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content. Additionally, if in the list menu state, palpable content. (list menu is the default state, unless the parent element is a <menu> in the context menu state.)
properties.Permitted content:
If the element is in the list menu state: flow content, or alternatively, zero or more occurrences of <li>, <script>, and <template>.
    If the element is in the context menu state: zero or more occurrences, in any order, of <menu> (context menu state only), <menuitem>, <hr>, <script>, and <template>.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: Must have a start tag and must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: The <menu> element, where that element is in the popup menu state. (If specified, the type attribute of the <menu> element must be popup; if missing, the parent element of the <menu> must itself be a <menu> in the popup menu state.)

properties.Content categories: Metadata content. If the itemprop attribute is present: flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: As it is a void element, the start tag must be present and the end tag must not be present
properties.Permitted parent elements: <meta charset>, <meta http-equiv>: a <head> element. If the http-equiv is not an encoding declaration, it can also be inside a <noscript> element, itself inside a <head> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, labelable content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Phrasing content, but there must be no <meter> element among its descendants.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, sectioning content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content, flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Permitted content:
When scripting is disabled and when it is a descendant of the <head> element: in any order, zero or more <link> elements, zero or more <style> elements, and zero or more <meta> elements.
    When scripting is disabled and when it isn't a descendant of the <head> element: any transparent content, but no <noscript> element must be among its descendants.
    Otherwise: flow content or phrasing content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content, if there are no ancestor <noscript> element, or in a <head> element (but only for an HTML document), here again if there are no ancestor <noscript> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content; phrasing content; embedded content, palpable content; if the element has a usemap attribute, interactive content; listed, submittable form-associated element.
properties.Permitted content: zero or more <deviceid> elements, then transparent.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, and if the <ol> element's children include at least one <li> element, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Zero or more <li> elements, which in turn often contain nested <ol> or <ul> elements.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag is mandatory. The end tag is optional if this element is immediately followed by another <optgroup> element, or if the parent element has no more content.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <select> element.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag is mandatory. The end tag is optional if this element is immediately followed by another <option> element or an <optgroup>, or if the parent element has no more content.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <select>, an <optgroup> or a <datalist> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, listed, labelable, resettable  form-associated element, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.

properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: As it is a void element, the start tag must be present and the end tag must not be present.
properties.Permitted parent elements: An <object> before any flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, labelable content, palpable content.
properties.Permitted content: Phrasing content, but there must be no <progress> element among its descendants.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <ruby> element. <rp> must be positioned immediately before or after an <rt> element.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The end tag may be omitted if the <rt> element is immediately followed by an <rt> or <rp> element, or if there is no more content in the parent element
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <ruby> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: See prose

properties.Content categories: Phrasing content or flow content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content, Flow content, Phrasing content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts metadata content, or any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, Sectioning content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that a <section> element must not be a descendant of an <address> element.

properties.Content categories: Transparent content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts flow content.

properties.\n Usage Context\n: A media element (<audio> or <video>, and it should be placed before any flow content or <track> element.
properties.Permitted parent elements: A element, and it should be placed before the element.
properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Permitted content: None, it is an empty element.
properties.Tag omission: It must have start tag, but must not have an end tag.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content, or any element that accepts flow content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLSpanElement (before HTML 5, the interface was HTMLElement)

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, must have both a start tag and an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content, or any element that accepts flow content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content, and if the scoped attribute is present: flow content.
properties.Permitted content: Text content matching the type attribute, that is text/css.
properties.Tag omission: Neither tag is omissible.
properties.Permitted parent elements:
If the scoped attribute is not present: where metadata content is expected or in a <noscript> element itself a child of <head> element.
    If the scoped attribute is present: where flow content is expected, but before any other flow content other than inter-element whitespace and <style> elements, and not as the child of an element whose content model is transparent.

properties.Permitted content: Phrasing content or one element of Heading content
properties.Tag omission: None, both the start tag and the end tag are mandatory.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content, flow content, phrasing content, script-supporting element
properties.Permitted content: Metadata content, flow content, any valid HTML content that is permitted to occur within the <ol>, <dl>, <figure>, <ruby>, <object>, <video>, <audio>, <table>, <colgroup>, <thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>, <tr>, <fieldset>, <select>, <details> elements and <menu> whose type attribute is in popup menu state.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: <body>, <frameset>, <head> and <colgroup> without a span attribute

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, Interactive content, listed, labelable, resettable, and submittable form-associated element.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: None.
properties.Tag omission: The start tag is mandatory. The end tag may be omitted if the <tbody> element is immediately followed by an, eventually implicitly-defined, <tbody>, or if there is no more content in the parent <table> element.
properties.Permitted parent elements:
A <table> element. The <tfoot> must appear after any <caption>, <colgroup> or <thead> element. It can be before or after all <tbody> and <tr> elements, but not intermixed with them.
    HTML 4 The <tfoot> element cannot be placed after any <tbody> and <tr> element. This restriction has been softened in HTML5.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None; both the starting and ending tags are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Metadata content.
properties.Permitted content: Text that is not inter-element whitespace
properties.Tag omission: Both opening and closing tags are required. Note that leaving off </title> should cause the browser to ignore the rest of the page
properties.Permitted parent elements: A <head> element that contains no other <title> element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
properties.DOM interface: HTMLElement Up to Gecko 1.9.2 (Firefox 4) inclusive, Firefox implements the HTMLSpanElement interface for this element.

properties.Content categories: Flow content
properties.Permitted content: zero or more <li> elements, which in turn often contain nested <ol> or <ul> elements.
properties.Tag omission: none, both the start tag and the end tag are mandatory
properties.Permitted parent elements: any element that accept flowing content

properties.Tag omission: Both start and end tags are required
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.

properties.Content categories: Flow content, phrasing content, embedded content. If it has a controls attribute: interactive content and palpable content.
properties.Permitted content:
If the element has a src attribute: zero or more <track> elements, followed by transparent content that contains no media elements — that is no <audio> or <video>

    Else: zero or more <source> elements, followed by zero or more <track> elements, followed by transparent content that contains no media elements — that is no <audio> or <video>.
properties.Tag omission: None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts embedded content.

properties.Tag omission: It is an empty element; it must have a start tag, but must not have an end tag.
properties.Permitted parent elements: Any element that accepts phrasing content.
